meanings.definition: To gradually reduce the strength or effectiveness of something through sustained pressure or attack.
meanings.sent1: The constant criticism will attrit his confidence over time.
meanings.sent2: The harsh weather attrits the paint on the old house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to attrit the dog's patience by stealing its toys.
meanings.sent4: The relentless waves attrit the rocks along the shore, shaping them into smooth pebbles.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive stress of typing all day attrits the keyboard keys, causing them to wear out quickly.
